DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Response Description Adverse Event Therapeutic Procedure Timepoint TimeValue
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._The representation of time for certain attributes in the system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Response Description Adverse Event Therapeutic Procedure Timepoint

Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/5/12 - Released as part of caAERS v2.0 model cleanup.  jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The representation of time for certain attributes in the system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/13/12 - Released as part of caAERS v2.0 model cleanup.  jc
